content.question: The writer wants to add a sentence after sentence 5 to elaborate on sentence 5’s description of the contrast between infrastructure with and without sensors for data collection. Which of the following sentences would best accomplish this goal?

choices.label: These vulnerabilities may soon be addressed through a set of “smart” robotics designed to fix and update the software needed to keep sensors functioning smoothly.
“Smart” water-detection systems are quite unlike smart electricity systems in that, while they can detect problems, they are not able to self-regulate.
Water pipes, roads, and other elements of conventional infrastructure last for decades precisely because they are not “smart”: they are structures with relatively simple, easy-to-replace parts.
Sensors using “smart” technologies can now register and distribute over a hundred times more data than sensors could ten years ago.

content.answer: Water pipes, roads, and other elements of conventional infrastructure last for decades precisely because they are not “smart”: they are structures with relatively simple, easy-to-replace parts.
